li.p: Before starting the work instruction activity, perform the following steps:
Do not begin these tasks without confirmation that the personnel directly involved have completed the required training associated with the work instruction activity and have reviewed this document.
Gather necessary tools and equipment as identified below in the Equipment Section.
Wear and use any additional Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and safety equipment required for this specific work instruction.
Obey all applicable safety requirements and procedures.
Notify the appropriate personnel of the activity and the estimated time needed to complete the tasks.
To inspect the tin hood equipment, perform the following steps:
Confirm proper exhaust draft system operation by checking for the odor of MBTC (Monobutyltin Trichloride).
Monitor the level of MBTC (tracking usage) and any changes to the container.
Monitor the temperature of the hood (tracking temperature) and ensure that the alarm operates properly.
Monitor the MBTC pump settings.
Inspect the jammed-ware detector and confirm that the sensor is operating properly.
Confirm that the distance between the underside of the mid-section and the top of the finish of the bottle is 5mm.
Confirm the proper operation of the Central Feeding Unit (CFU), if applicable
Check the piston-pump reservoir oil level, if applicable.
Check the pump area for leaks.
Confirm that MBTC is available in the tank.
Confirm the absence of bubbles inside the tube
To inspect DFE (DuPont 152a gas â€“ 1,1-difluoroethane) equipment when it is used in a job, perform the following steps:
Confirm that the DFE pressure and the air pressure are within specification.
Confirm that the injection tube is in the proper location.
Confirm that the alignment guides are correct.
Confirm that there is a spare tank available.
Review the quality DFE records.
Upon completion of tasks, perform the following steps:
Perform basic housekeeping duties. Clean up the work space, tools, and equipment. Dispose of trash. Put tools and equipment in their assigned areas.
Notify the appropriate personnel that the work instruction activity has been completed
Record and report findings and results.
Follow appropriate instructions for the notification of findings and results relating to specifications, targets, and/or reaction limits.
